snippet: The arrangement to sell copies The Wall Street Journal Europe through bulk sales at seminars was "complex," Audit Bureau of Circulations in Britain found, but also permissible. The newspaper has since stopped the practice.
abstract: The arrangement to sell copies The Wall Street Journal Europe through bulk sales at seminars was "complex," Audit Bureau of Circulations in Britain found, but also permissible. The newspaper has since stopped the practice.
lead_paragraph: The British auditing group investigating a complex circulation practice at The Wall Street Journal Europe, which led to the resignation of the paper's publisher in October, said Wednesday that the practice complied with its official newspaper circulation reporting standards.

headline.main: Audit Group Accepts Circulation Practice of The Journal in Europe
